title: 2 Easy Ways to Clear Your Saved Drafts in Gmail

steps.title: Open a browser.
steps.content: Open a browser. Popular ones include Firefox and Chrome.

steps.title: Navigate to https://www.google.com/gmail.
steps.content: Navigate to https://www.google.com/gmail . Log in if prompted.

steps.title: Click Drafts.
steps.content: Click Drafts . This is in the menu to the left along with Inbox and Snoozed. All your email drafts will appear.

steps.title: Click next to the draft you want to delete.
steps.content: Click next to the draft you want to delete. A check will mark the draft. You can select multiple drafts by selecting multiple boxes.

steps.title: Click Discard drafts.
steps.content: Click Discard drafts . You'll see this button in the menu bar near the top of the page. Your selected draft will disappear. If you open a specific email draft, you can also click the trash can icon to delete that draft.

steps.title: Open Gmail.
steps.content: Open Gmail. This app icon looks like a white envelope with a red border. You can find this app on your home screen, in the app drawer, or by searching.

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . This is in the upper left of your screen. A menu will slide out from the side.

steps.title: Tap Drafts.
steps.content: Tap Drafts . Your drafts will open.

steps.title: Tap the circular icon next to your draft.
steps.content: Tap the circular icon next to your draft. You'll usually see a profile picture or a circle with a letter in it depending on who sent the original email. The icon will change colors to indicate that the draft is selected. You can select multiple drafts by clicking multiple icons.

steps.title: Tap the trash can .
steps.content: Tap the trash can . Your selected draft will disappear.
